WorkItem.Description:
If not numeric string is marked as date or number in Excel then it still appears as text in Excel, but method PHPExcel_Style_NumberFormat::toFormattedString() still tries to format it and returns empty value instead of initial string.
Â 
My suggestion is to check the input value with "is_numeric" before formatting.
WorkItem.Summary: Not numeric strings are formatted as dates and numbers using worksheet's toArray method

Comments.Message:
The fix is not correct. 
Instead of the line

if (!is_float($value) || !is_numeric($value)) return $value;

there should be

if (!is_float($value) && !is_numeric($value)) return $value;

but just is_numeric check would be enough (it validates both -- float and integer values).
The problem with current fix is that integer values are not formatted at all (is_float check fails).
